KUO?
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis lit, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Paulu:
Your lengthy, single-spaced protestation of innocence has been received
and noted. I realize the effort you must have put into this essay and
regret that I find it obscure in some places and contrary to fact in
others. The unconscious humor of your statement that Harold hand's talk
contained a significant analysis of educational broadcasting in the face
of the man's correct statement that he knew little or nothing about that
subject, is a case in point. Can you seriously deny that in terms of
numbers involved, work performed and trouble taken, the Follies was "the
major effort" of the convention? If you can, you will need better argu¬
ments than Hand's significant analysis. My remarks were much closer to
understatement than to hyperbole.
Similarly no one with any basic parliamentary experience will be con¬
vinced that tabling a recommendation is a simple matter of delaying con¬
sideration. I am now sure that the recommendations will be considered
but you will pardon me if I feel this liappy result stems largely from
efforts of mine subsequent to the Convention. Incidentally the prelimin¬
ary minutes are in error in referring to the "Schwarzwalder proposals."
As I understand it the proposals were adopted and recommended by the TV
Operations and Development Committee. I am proud to have suggested the
proposals but they are no longer mine (. veept in theeyes of those who
want to defeat them).
Another small point full of unconscious humor was your citation of the
Allerton House Conference as an NAEB aid to ETV in the same letter in
which you admitted the Board of the NAEB had tabled the two ETV proposals
which came out of the Conference.
As to the domination of NAEB by Midwestern Radio Stations I fail to see
how you can deny it. As long as WTTfo, with an $800,000.00 budget, serving
6,000,000 people has the same voting power as, say, KSTE (FM) in Emporia,
Kansas, this domination will continue. I am not blaming you, personally,
for this situation, I simply object to your saying it is not a fact and
I feel you are not entirely candid when you fail to admit the truth of my
contention. The "Midwestern social club" remark is equally true. For
the phrase I am indebted to Dick hull who used it at the convention and
said the NAEB was that and a lot of other things as well. I agree fully
with his statement but not, I think, with what he meant.
